column4: is there a way i can download all the ubuntu updates since last release
im going to be installing ubuntu on a dialup box, no way I want it to download it all over 56k
how big is the average one?
archive.ubuntu.com if you can figure your way around
but that has warty, hoary, and breezy stuff all lumped together in /pool
yeah im just going with the latest update branch
so what would i need to d/l that i could feed into synaptic so that everything can be updated easily?
isn't there some distfiles directory that i could just put them all
so synaptic/apt-get dosn't have to d/l them
I know there is a dir that apt checks before pulling them off the internet but I'm on windows right now so I can't look it up. Sorry.
You're not running the extensions that break it.
alright i was worried firefox was severaly broken, not just a minor bug
pretty major if you have one of the extensions installed
